abstract: National Institutes of Health and National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke issue $16 million in grants to study chronic traumatic encephalopathy in former college and professional football players; first study among living players, which includes no financial contribution from NFL, is attempt to understand disease more fully; results could affect disputed settlement between league and deceased players found with CTE.
lead_paragraph: The league will not help pay for a study to try to find a way to diagnose a degenerative brain disease, despite its potential implications for football players.

headline.main: $16 Million for Brain Research, but $0 from N.F.L.
headline.print_headline: $16 Million for Brain Study, but $0 From N.F.L.

snippet: The league will not help pay for a study to try to find a way to diagnose a degenerative brain disease, despite its potential implications for football players.

keywords.value: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke
keywords.name: organizations
